DataElement.preferredName: Neoadjuvant Therapy Pathology Therapeutic Effect Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was beneficial responses or outcomes observed based on the structural and functional changes following treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related the beneficial responses or outcomes based on the structural and functional changes following treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.

Concepts.definition: Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98):Therapeutic Effect; a drug's intended effect or result.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Beneficial responses or outcomes in the prevention, treatment, or progression of a disease resulting from treatment intervention. Therapeutic effect includes prevention or reduction of adverse effects. (NCI)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
